titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding the regulatory burdens imposed by the Health Care Financing Administration on suppliers of durable medical equipment under the Medicare Program.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: 5/5/1999--Introduced. Declares the sense of Congress that greater active oversight is required of the Health Care Financing Administration's administration of the durable medical equipment (DME) benefit under title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act.
